item.title: Rocket Internet shows signs of coming back down to earth - FT.com
item.description:
Rocket Internet shows signs of coming back down to earth - FT.com

In March, Rocket Internet published a prospectus for its new investment fund touting eight "emerging stars" in its portfolio of start-ups. One of them was Paymill, a company that processes online payments. A month later, the start-up filed for

item.title: Asian Startups Hit by Venture-Capital Slowdown
item.description:
Asian Startups Hit by Venture-Capital Slowdown

In early February, Yin Sang, a prominent Chinese entrepreneur, sent an email to all 600 employees at his karaoke-booking startup: His firm was running out of money after failing to raise funds and wouldn't be able to pay staff salaries. "Our cash flow is almost zero," the 23-year-old chief executive of Yiqi Chang wrote in the email, reviewed by...

item.title: Android Pay set for imminent UK launch as Pret A Manger plugs Google mobile payments
item.description:
Android Pay set for imminent UK launch as Pret A Manger plugs Google mobile payments

Smartphone-wielding shoppers will then be able to pay at retailers equipped with a contactless payment terminal, with their identity verified by their smartphone's fingerprint reader. Stores that will accept it include Pret, Boots, Starbucks, Costa Coffee and Waitrose. You can also use Android Pay on Transport for London services such as the Tube and buses.

item.title: Discounting is killing online retailers. Here's how one startup is trying to fix that.
item.description:
Discounting is killing online retailers. Here's how one startup is trying to fix that.

Mark Walker had two goals for his startup this year: Get its new line of clothing into as many guys' homes as possible and get them to pay full price. He would have to get creative. Walker, after...

Jessica Alba on the beginnings and progression of The Honest Company (clip)

item.title: Watch the First Full-Scale Demo of the Hyperloop
item.description:
Watch the First Full-Scale Demo of the Hyperloop

A hyperloop startup has built the first full-scale test track for the transportation system in the desert outside Las Vegas. Today, Hyperloop One (formerly Hyperloop Technologies) pushed a test vehicle down a rail track at speeds of up to 300 mph using the hyperloop's propulsion technology. It looked like a really fast roller coaster.

item.title: Elon Musk just made a totally mind-blowing change to Tesla's strategy
item.description:
Elon Musk just made a totally mind-blowing change to Tesla's strategy

Tesla reported first-quarter earnings on Wednesday, and they were better than expected: Tesla lost less money than analysts thought the company would. After the numbers hit, CEO Elon Musk and his team held a conference call. And Tesla kicked it off with a bang.

item.title: The people who made Siri are readying another big leap in AI
item.description:
The people who made Siri are readying another big leap in AI

Viv is planned as an open system -- more like the original Siri prior to being purchased by Apple in 2010 -- and currently features links to apps and services like Uber, FTD, SeatGuru and GrubHub. The example in the article describes ordering a pizza from Domino's without so much as making a phone call or opening an app.

item.title: Payment startup Zooz raises $24 million as global fintech looks for standards
item.description:
Payment startup Zooz raises $24 million as global fintech looks for standards

As payment solutions proliferate and calls for standardization mount, Israel-based payment platform startup Zooz said it has closed a $24 million led by Target Global Ventures, to expand globally and bolster its products and services. Zooz's series C round more than doubles the total amount invested in the company to $40.5 million, raised in four rounds.
